At DeepL, you'll join the QA Developer Experience team, a crucial part of the broader Developer Experience track. This team is at the heart of our engineering ecosystem, driving the overall testing strategy and ensuring a high-quality experience across our algorithms, infrastructure, and applications. As part of the developer experience family, you'll collaborate with teams across product, research and platform engineering, leveraging a wealth of knowledge and best practices.

We cultivate a strong quality-first culture, where every team member is empowered to advocate for customer experience improvements. Our agile teams promote close collaboration, and as a QA Engineering Manager, you will be instrumental in fostering this collaborative environment. You'll not only lead your team in shaping our test automation frameworks and tooling but also play a key role in building a strong community within the QA craft. This role offers unique opportunities to drive quality across the full technology stack, working collaboratively with various stakeholders to deliver exceptional customer experiences.


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

The core purpose of the Engineering Manager role is to develop an engineering team to an autonomous, high performing stage:

 - Delivery & Excellence: Collaborate with stakeholders, representing the team's quality perspective on new or existing services and products, focusing on testability and automation potential. Align roadmaps with priorities, ensure new features enable timely delivery with integrated testing, and establish high-level engineering excellence metrics for automated quality. Provide strong technical oversight by resolving complex automation challenges, participating in test framework design, and driving robust test automation strategies. Drive continuous improvement of DeepL, practices, and technology, emphasizing increased test automation coverage and efficiency for high-pace, high-quality delivery.

 - People Leadership: Inspire, develop, recruit, and motivate a cross-functional quality engineering & automation team. Conduct regular 1:1s with team members, set individual development or improvement plans, and foster a healthy, non-retaliatory feedback culture within the team.

 - Team Management: As a collaborative partner with other engineering leads, jointly oversee the team’s strategy, quarterly goals, and business-technical metrics. Ensure the team's development process methodology is optimal, actively participate in building and maintaining the technical roadmap, and take ownership of technical incident management. Dedicate time and resources to quality efforts, maintain a current knowledge base and documentation for the team's services and artifacts, and coordinate resource planning in collaboration with the DevEx track lead and track Leads as needed.

 - Manage growth: You derive satisfaction from navigating change and collaboratively discovering innovative solutions with your team and various stakeholders within a dynamic and evolving environment.

 - Strategic Leadership: Responsibility includes guiding the strategic direction of the team's engagements and collaborating with stakeholders on the overall DeepL testing strategy. Not directly hands-on in delivering, the role necessitates an understanding and ability to translate business needs into clear, actionable testing requirements for engineers. A profound understanding of technical architecture, potential challenges, and aligning the team's work with broader organizational goals.


A DAY IN THE LIFE

As an Engineering Manager for the QA Developer Experience team, shaping the overall testing strategy and driving a significant shift towards automation. Your mornings will involve collaborating with product and engineering leaders to define comprehensive testing strategies and roadmaps, ensuring alignment with organizational goals for quality and speed. You'll oversee the ownership, development, and evolution of our core testing frameworks and tooling, identifying opportunities to enhance developer experience and maximize automation. Throughout the day, you'll engage with your team and product engineers to review technical designs, provide guidance on complex automation challenges, and champion best practices for testing. A key focus will be identifying areas where manual testing can be reduced or eliminated, leveraging innovative solutions and fostering a culture of automated quality. You will be instrumental in enabling engineering teams to deliver high-quality products faster through robust and efficient testing solutions.


QUALITIES WE LOOK FOR

 - High level of hands-on technical experience in software development and architecture

 - Proven track record of leading and scaling QA or software development teams in a business-facing role

 - Extensive industry experience as a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) or Software Development Engineer (SDE)

 - Strong programming skills with modern programming languages (we use C#, C++, Python, Typescript and Go) with proven expertise in architecting and implementing enterprise-level test automation frameworks

 - Strong understanding of software development principles, design patterns, and architectural concepts

 - Ability to balance developer experience with product needs

 - Ability to adapt easily to new environments and technologies in a scaling and rapidly changing environment

 - Excellent communication skills in English with a strong sense of empathy and a solutions-oriented mindset


PREFERRED QUALITIES

 - Advanced experience in building and maintaining automated testing infrastructure

 - Strong expertise in developing custom test frameworks and testing tools from scratch

 - Strong understanding of cloud architecture patterns and testing strategies

 - Proven track record of improving test coverage and testing efficiency through automation

 - Experience in architecting next-generation test infrastructure that combines traditional CI/CD pipelines with AI-driven decision-making for optimized test selection, parallel execution, and automated result analysis

 - Experience with innovative quality practices that leverage AI for automated analysis and predictive system reliability testing

 - Experience with self-healing test systems that use machine learning to adapt to application changes, automatically maintain test suites, and provide AI-driven insights into test coverage


WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

You are welcome at DeepL for who you are—we appreciate authenticity here. Our product is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all succeed, contribute, and think forward! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our diversity that we will find the power to break down language barriers in the world.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager - Platform
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Meet DeepL

DeepL is a global communications platform powered by Language AI. Since 2017, we’ve been on a mission to break down language barriers. Our human-sounding translations and intelligent writing suggestions are designed with enterprise security in mind. Today, they enable over 100,000 businesses to transform communications, reach new markets, and improve productivity. And, empower millions of individuals worldwide to make sense of the world and express their ideas.

Our goal is to become the global leader in Language AI, building products that drive better communication, foster connections, and make a real-life impact. To achieve this, we need talented individuals like you to join our exciting journey. If you're ready to work with a dynamic team and build your career in the fast-moving AI space, DeepL is your next destination.

What sets us apart

What sets us apart is our blend of modern technology, competitive benefits, and an open, welcoming work culture that enables our people to thrive. When we share what it's like to work at DeepL, the reactions are overwhelmingly positive. This may be because of our products that have helped countless people worldwide or our shared mission to improve communication for individuals and businesses, bringing cultures closer together. What we know for sure is this: being part of DeepL means joining a team dedicated to innovation and employee well-being. Discover what our teams have to say about life at DeepL on LinkedIn, Instagram and our Blog.

Meet the team behind this journey

We're looking for an Engineering Manager to lead one of two co-operating platform teams within the same unit, responsible for our internal developer platform. This role will be leading the team who primarily focus on providing the Kubernetes and Ceph clusters to our product development teams.

This team works closely with our in-house Data Center Operations team, who manage the in-house hardware, and our primary cloud provider, AWS. The other team within the same business unit manages the software services such as Redis, Postgres, Kafka, Grafana, etc. Both teams share an on-call ownership of these areas, so collaboration and broad knowledge of these areas is valuable

Your responsibilities

The core purpose of the Engineering Manager role is to develop their engineering team to an autonomous, high performing stage and take responsibility for ensuring high quality service delivery:

  • Delivery & Excellence: Collaborating with key stakeholders, representing what the platform currently can and will do, the team’s perspective on the feasibility, cost-effectiveness, scalability, and time-to-market aspects of new or existing services and products. Ensure timely delivery of new capabilities, maintain existing ones, and establish high engineering excellence metrics. Actively contribute to resolving technical issues and challenges by participating in tech reviews, system design discussions, and occasionally engaging in hands-on work to support team members. Support the team and participate in a humane on-call offering. Support and enable the team to effectively balance competing priorities between planned and unplanned work.

  • People Leadership: Inspire, develop, recruit, and motivate a platform engineering team. Conduct regular 1:1s with team members, set individual development or improvement plans, and foster a healthy, non-retaliatory feedback culture within the team.

  • Team Management: As a collaborative partner with a member of the Infrastructure Operations team, oversee the team’s strategy, quarterly goals, and business-technical metrics. Ensure the team's processes remain effective, actively participate in building and maintaining the technical roadmap, and take ownership of technical incident management. Dedicate time and resources to quality efforts, maintain a current knowledge base and documentation for the team's services and artifacts, and coordinate planning in collaboration with the Senior Engineering Manager and Craft Leads as needed.

  • Manage growth: You derive satisfaction from navigating change and collaboratively discovering innovative solutions with your team and various stakeholders within a dynamic and evolving environment.

  • Strategic Leadership: Co-develop and take ownership of the team's strategy, inline with broader objectives. Ensure and communicate the team's progress to stakeholders. Not directly involved in software delivery, the role necessitates a profound understanding of technical architecture, potential challenges, and aligning the team's work with broader organizational goals.

  • Participation in our on-call rotation: You’ll ensure the reliability and availability of our services by being available to join the team's shared on-call rotation as needed.

Qualities we look for

  • Track record of successfully leading and scaling a platform (/DevOps/Infrastructure/SRE) team.

  • High degree of hands-on technical experience in platform development and architecture, with several years of experience working as a senior engineer

  • You would enjoy a 30% share of hands-on technical work (code and architecture reviews, technical design, hands-on work, ...)

  • Experience in platform and system design

  • Expertise with Kubernetes - Cloud-managed and on-prem, ideally Ceph too

  • Experience with several of: AWS, on-prem, Terraform, ACK, ArgoCD, Harbor

  • You are a pragmatic problem solver who enjoys both the technical and non-technical challenges associated with the responsibilities of an Engineering Manager

  • Excellent communication skills in English with a strong sense of empathy and a solution-oriented mindset

  • Ability to identify tactical and strategic priorities and help navigate the team through a long request list to achieve long term objectives.

  • Don’t be put off if you meet most but not all of these areas - we’d still love to hear from you!

What we offer

  • Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing–we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

  • Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy and growth mindset makes us better together.

  • Hybrid work, flexible hours: we offer a hybrid work schedule, with team members coming into the office twice a week. This allows you to engage directly with your team and experience the unique energy of our workspace, while still enjoying the flexibility and comfort of working from home. With flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, we are in sync with your team’s general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration.

  • Virtual Shares - An ownership mindset in every role. We believe everyone should share in our success, and that’s why every employee receives Virtual Shares, linking your contribution directly to DeepL’s growth and rewarding you with a stake in our future.

  • Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings, to company-wide events that bring us all together–literally.

  • Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams–we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

  • 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.

  • Virtual Shares: An ownership mindset in every role. We believe everyone should share in our success, and that’s why every employee receives Virtual Shares, linking your contribution directly to DeepL’s growth and rewarding you with a stake in our future.

  • Competitive benefits: just as our team spans the globe, so does our benefits package. We've crafted it to reflect the diversity of our team and tailored it to align with your unique location, to ensure you feel supported every step of the way.

If this role and our mission resonate with you, but you're hesitant because you don't check all the boxes, don't let that hold you back. At DeepL, it's all about the value you bring and the growth we can foster together. Go ahead, apply—let's discover your potential together. We can't wait to meet you!

We are an equal opportunity employer

You are welcome at DeepL for who you are—we appreciate authenticity here. Our product is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all succeed, contribute, and think forward! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our diversity that we will find the power to break down language barriers in the world.

You’ll be a high-energy, strategic, and coaching-focused leader, responsible for the professional growth and development of your team. By building strong cross-functional relationships — including with Sales, Marketing, Product, Engineering, Support, and Finance — you’ll stay ahead of product innovations, ensure customer feedback informs our roadmap, and guide your team to deliver compelling solutions during complex sales cycles. You’ll be a technical thought leader and advocate, continually refining best practices for demos, technical assessments, and workshops, while championing customer needs to further DeepL’s mission and market expansion.

  • Be a thought leader, customer advocate, and partner to employees and customers, providing senior-level technical guidance to support sales.

  • Act as a customer champion, ensuring feedback and insights are channelled effectively into DeepL’s product roadmap, messaging, and overall customer experience.

  • Demonstrated experience mentoring, coaching, and leading teams with a focus on pre-sales engineering, solution consulting, or similar customer-facing technical roles.

  • 5+ years of hands-on experience in a Solutions Consultant, Sales Engineering, or equivalent function within the SaaS industry.

  • Proven track record of building high-performing teams that meet and exceed objectives.

  • Demonstrate strong customer empathy and passion for revenue growth, backed by in-depth knowledge of enterprise technology solutions.

  • Outstanding leadership skills, with a commitment to cultivating talent, fostering collaboration, and promoting a culture of continuous learning.

  • Exceptional communication skills across mediums and stakeholder groups — capable of simplifying complex concepts and presenting them effectively to diverse audiences (employees, execs, customers, prospects).

  • Strong strategic thinking and project management abilities, using both data and intuition to solve problems and make decisions.

  • An enthusiastic and creative leader who is eager to develop and learn, and who inspires a similar attitude in others.

  • A passion for solutions consulting, technological innovation, and overcoming language barriers on a global scale.

  • Experience with Salesforce or related CRM tools is preferred

  • Fluency in Japanese and English required, and additional language skills (German, French) a plus.

 - Recruit, onboard, and develop new team members, creating robust training frameworks that accelerate ramp-up time and maintain high performance.

 - 5+ years of hands-on experience in a Solutions Consultant, Sales Engineering, or equivalent function within the SaaS industry.

 - Proven track record of building high-performing teams that meet and exceed objectives.

 - Demonstrate strong customer empathy and passion for revenue growth, backed by in-depth knowledge of enterprise technology solutions.

 - Outstanding leadership skills, with a commitment to cultivating talent, fostering collaboration, and promoting a culture of continuous learning.

 - Exceptional communication skills across mediums and stakeholder groups — capable of simplifying complex concepts and presenting them effectively to diverse audiences (employees, execs, customers, prospects).

 - Strong strategic thinking and project management abilities, using both data and intuition to solve problems and make decisions.

 - An enthusiastic and creative leader who is eager to develop and learn, and who inspires a similar attitude in others.

 - A passion for solutions consulting, technological innovation, and overcoming language barriers on a global scale.

 - Experience with Salesforce or related CRM tools is preferred

 - Fluency in Japanese and English required, and additional language skills (German, French) a plus.


WHAT WE OFFER

 - Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing–we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

 - Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy and growth mindset makes us better together.

 - Hybrid work, flexible hours: we offer a hybrid work schedule, with team members coming into the office twice a week. This allows you to engage directly with your team and experience the unique energy of our workspace, while still enjoying the flexibility and comfort of working from home. With flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, we are in sync with your team’s general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration.

Responsibilities

  • Own the onboarding and implementation process for individual customers, setting them up for a successful long-term partnership

  • Understand how these companies leverage different translation methods/tools and how our technology works cohesively with their tech stack

  • Serve as the customer’s project manager during the onboarding process, working closely with key and/or executive-level stakeholders across the organisation

  • Teach and empower new customers how to get the most value out of the DeepL platform

  • Troubleshoot challenges that customers experience as they get the system set up

  • Project manage new use cases for existing customers (new departments, markets, and/or platform integrations)

  • Interface with internal DeepL teams, including Support, Engineering, and Product Management, in order to effectively integrate your customer with our software

  • Keep projects on track: escalate issues that are blocking a successful launch; rally either your customer or internally at DeepL in order to deliver on time

  • Become a subject matter expert on DeepL’s product capabilities and implementation process, and provide input into the implementation process for new product launches

Qualities we look for

  • 3+ years of work experience, with at least one year in client-facing software implementation or account management at a SaaS company 

  • Proven success project managing implementations on time and within scope

  • Ability to learn technical concepts quickly and communicate to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Excellent written and oral communication, as well as presentation skills

  • Demonstrated ability to resolve issues and maintain strong customer relationships

We’re looking for a diligent and dedicated Customer Success Manager to care, advocate for and grow important customer relationships at one of Europe’s fastest growing technology companies backed by top investors who helped scale Uber, Twitter, Instagram, and Zendesk. Specifically, we’re looking for someone who can build and deepen our connections with senior stakeholders, conduct technical and commercial conversations with various teams, own onboarding and drive product adoption within a subset of our customer base. In a nutshell, create loyal fans!


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Customer Success Manager at Agentic AI, you will join a brand-new team dedicated to launching and scaling DeepL's most innovative product to date. This is an exciting opportunity to shape how our customers adopt and succeed with our AI solutions, and to make a real impact. We’re looking for someone hands-on, who thrives in areas of uncertainty and isn’t afraid to tackle challenges head-on. In this role, you will work closely with our customers to ensure their success, build strong relationships and help them to unlock the full potential of Agentic AI.

Your key responsibilities will include:

 - Understand customer ecosystems, priorities, and goals to foster trust and long-term partnerships.

 - Be a Trusted Advisor conducting data-driven business reviews to demonstrate value and align solutions with customer objectives.

 - Build trust with senior decision-makers to ensure strategic alignment and success.

 - Onboard effectively by partnering with internal teams to align processes with customer goals and ensure early success.

 - Promote product adoption by strategically introducing solutions to key stakeholders.

 - Leverage knowledge of workflows, APIs, and integrations to assist with implementation.

 - Collaborate with sales to uncover upsell and cross-sell potential.

 - Guide customers on using product features to maximise value.

 - Work cross-functionally to address customer needs and resolve issues efficiently.

 - Meet targets for adoption, retention, and customer advocacy through a data-driven approach.

 - Provide feedback to leadership and product teams to drive continuous improvement.


QUALITIES WE LOOK FOR

We’re seeking a Customer Success Manager who thrives in a fast-paced, innovative environment and is excited to join a new team and product at its early stages. This role is perfect for someone who’s hands-on, adaptable, and energised by the opportunity to shape something from the ground up.

The ideal candidate will have:

 - 4+ years of customer success experience or account management. Focus on retention and customer satisfaction. With a proven track record in renewals and upsell/cross-sell opportunities.

 - Experience working with SaaS platforms or AI-driven solutions is essential.

 - A solid understanding of technical workflows, APIs, integrations, and data handling.

 - Experience supporting customers who integrate solutions into their own products or workflows is preferred.

 - Strong presentation, verbal, and written communication skills, with the ability to engage and influence senior stakeholders.

 - Exceptional organisational skills to manage multiple accounts and priorities effectively.

 - A strong drive to learn, solve challenges, and work with emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions.

 - A proactive, can-do attitude with the ability to take ownership and work through challenges in a dynamic environment.

 - Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment, balancing strategic thinking with tactical execution.

 - A collaborative spirit, contributing to a positive team culture and supporting colleagues.

 - Fluency in German and English is required.

 - Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities.   • A continuous learning mindset—openness to trying different approaches and adapting to new technologies

  • Comfortable with a hybrid working model and able to come into any of our offices regularly (2x per week average).

  • Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams–we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

  • 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.

  • Competitive benefits: just as our team spans the globe, so does our benefits package. We've crafted it to reflect the diversity of our team and tailored it to align with your unique location, to ensure you feel supported every step of the way.

If this role and our mission resonate with you, but you're hesitant because you don't check all the boxes, don't let that hold you back. At DeepL, it's all about the value you bring and the growth we can foster together. Go ahead, apply—let's discover your potential together. We can't wait to meet you!

To achieve this, we need talented individuals like you to join our exciting journey. If you're ready to work with a dynamic team and build your career in the fast-moving AI space, DeepL is your next destination.

What sets us apart

What sets us apart is our blend of modern technology, competitive benefits, and an open, welcoming work culture that enables our people to thrive. When we share what it's like to work at DeepL, the reactions are overwhelmingly positive. This may be because of our products that have helped countless people worldwide or our shared mission to improve communication for individuals and businesses, bringing cultures closer together. What we know for sure is this: being part of DeepL means joining a team dedicated to innovation and employee well-being. Discover what our teams have to say about life at DeepL on LinkedIn, Instagram and our Blog.

Meet the team behind this journey

DeepL is tech for good, dismantling language barriers around the world and constantly expanding to new markets. Be part of our growth right at the center of the DeepL customer experience by helping us provide excellent support to customers all around the world with a focus on payment processing and fraud detection. Join a diverse, friendly and enthusiastic team that hails from all corners of the globe and all walks of life - we are looking forward to becoming even more effective together with you!

Your responsibilities

  • Provide timely and accurate responses via our support system to our Premium Enterprise Customers

  • Maintain high service standards, understand specific customer needs, troubleshoot, escalate issues, and identify product bugs

  • Provide top quality service while maintaining global and personal KPIs

  • Identify product bugs and feature requests and escalate to relevant teams accurately if required

  • Achieve personal KPI’s and actively contribute to team KPI’s

  • Become an ambassador for DeepL’s products and an expert on our customers’ needs

  • You will tackle complex customer requests including payment and technical issues via e-mail, and at times via other channels such as messaging and/or chat & phone

  • Provide guidance to our Premium Support customers on DeepL product features and functionality

  • Collaborate closely with the rest of the Customer Support Team to ensure that customer issues are resolved quickly and effectively

  • Respond to customers when system outages occur, within the agreed timeframes; be the conduit between our Dev Ops team and our customer during these system outages ensuring they are kept up to date

  • Work alongside backend support teams as needed in order to resolve more complex customer issues, following up with the customer until resolution

  • Help the wider Customer Support team with customer tickets when Premium ticket volume is low

  • There will be the occasional requirement to be on call outside of core business hours in order to support key customers around the clock

Qualities we look for

  • 3+ year Customer Support experience in a technical and/or payment support capacity

  • Excellent written communication skills, fluent Japanese and English; additional languages are advantageous

  • You love dealing with high valued customers, providing a best in class customer experience for our users

  • You enjoy working with international customers from around the world

  • Experience with troubleshooting complex technical issues related to payment processing and finding solutions for our customers in a friendly and productive manner

  • Solid experience with customer subscription systems

  • Flexibility in working hours required, including the ability to work 8 hour shifts between 6am and 5pm local time, 5 days a week (Monday – Sunday, so including weekend work) to ensure comprehensive coverage and exceptional customer support

  • In the early part of this project, flexibility to be part of an on-call rota (1 week in 6) covering evenings and weekends where platform outages occur

What we offer

  • Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing–we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

  • Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy and growth mindset makes us better together.

  • Hybrid work, flexible hours: we offer a hybrid work schedule, with team members coming into the office twice a week. This allows you to engage directly with your team and experience the unique energy of our workspace, while still enjoying the flexibility and comfort of working from home. With flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, we are in sync with your team’s general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration.

  • Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings, to company-wide events that bring us all together–literally.

  • Monthly hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams–we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

  • 20 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 20 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.

  • Competitive benefits: just as our team spans the globe, so does our benefits package. We've crafted it to reflect the diversity of our team and tailored it to align with your unique location, to ensure you feel supported every step of the way.

If this role and our mission resonate with you, but you're hesitant because you don't check all the boxes, don't let that hold you back. At DeepL, it's all about the value you bring and the growth we can foster together. Go ahead, apply—let's discover your potential together. We can't wait to meet you!

We are an equal opportunity employer

You are welcome at DeepL for who you are—we appreciate authenticity here. Our product is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all succeed, contribute, and think forward! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our diversity that we will find the power to break down language barriers in the world.

  • Serve as the primary escalation point for complex or non-standard deals, providing guidance to Sales on pricing, deal structure, and discounting.

  • Partner with Sales management to identify gaps and yielding opportunities.

  • Manage the end-to-end deal desk process, including review and approval of exceptions, ensuring compliance with company policies, legal requirements, and SLA requirements.

  • Identify and lead process and policy improvements, including automation (approval workflows, data analysis), to enhance deal desk efficiency and reduce deal cycle time.

  • Create and be able to defend and articulate scalable pricing proposals.

  • Contribute to creating, managing, and updating pricing tools (insights, quoting), and pricing repositories, ensuring they remain relevant and accessible.

  • Provide insights to executive management on deal trends, discounting patterns and performance metrics reviewed during MBRs and QBRs.

  • Partner with Deal Desk and Pricing Strategy leaders to operationalize pricing models and discounting frameworks.

Qualities we look for

  • 6+ years of experience in Deal Desk, Sales Operations, Revenue Operations, or Finance within SaaS companies.

  • Self-starter with a proactive approach to identifying and resolving issues.

  • Proven experience managing complex deal structures and driving process improvements.

  • Excellent communicator and cross-functional collaborator with the ability to influence stakeholders across all levels.

  • Strong financial and data analysis skills, with the ability to translate insights into actionable recommendations.

  • Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills to effectively handle multiple deals and projects at once.

  • Must be familiar with Salesforce.com, CPQ tools, Excel/Google Sheets, and MS PowerPoint/Google Slides

  • Fluency in written and spoken English

Even better if you have

  • Knowledge and experience of Salesforce and Chargebee, Metabase platforms.

  • Experience training or enabling Sales teams on pricing, quoting, and contract best practices.

  • Additional European languages.

What we offer

  • Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing–we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

With flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, we are in sync with your team’s general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration.

  • Virtual Shares - An ownership mindset in every role. We believe everyone should share in our success, and that’s why every employee receives Virtual Shares, linking your contribution directly to DeepL’s growth and rewarding you with a stake in our future.

  • Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings, to company-wide events that bring us all together–literally.

  • Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams–we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

  • 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.

  • You create a motivating and collaborative environment, where your colleagues set and achieve challenging developmental and business goals.

  • You are willing to work in a highly demanding, fast-changing and fast-paced environment. You bring business-oriented thinking, strong analytical, research, and problem-solving skills.

  • You are able to prioritize and organize your workload according to risks and company requirements in time-sensitive matters.

  • You are fluent in English

What we offer

What sets us apart

What sets us apart is our blend of modern technology, competitive benefits, and an open, welcoming work culture that enables our people to thrive. When we share what it's like to work at DeepL, the reactions are overwhelmingly positive. This may be because of our products that have helped countless people worldwide or our shared mission to improve communication for individuals and businesses, bringing cultures closer together. What we know for sure is this: being part of DeepL means joining a team dedicated to innovation and employee well-being. Discover what our teams have to say about life at DeepL on LinkedIn, Instagram and our Blog.

Meet the team behind this journey

We’re looking for a motivated self-starter to help us to rapidly grow our Enterprise footprint. You'll be responsible for building relationships with enterprise businesses within Japan, with a focus on both winning new business and maximizing expansion. We are looking for a proven track record as an Enterprise AE, who is passionate about our vision of a world without language barriers. As one of a small, strong team of Enterprise AEs, you will play a key role in shaping our Enterprise processes and playbook.

Your responsibilities

  • You will be at the forefront of DeepL’s rapid growth and present our market-leading translation service to clients in order to eliminate their language barriers

  • Become an ambassador for DeepL’s products and an expert on our customers’ needs in order to troubleshoot and rapidly resolve inquiries

  • As a trusted partner to potential new business and incoming customers, you will qualify and convert leads and manage the entire sales cycle

  • You strive to meet and exceed monthly activity, pipeline, and revenue goals. Additionally, you'll provide regular reporting of your pipeline and accurate forecasting through Salesforce

  • Build a pipeline of new business, and pursue upselling and cross-selling opportunities

  • Arranging and leading meetings with Executives and Senior Managers will be a major part of your day

  • Forecast and track all opportunity and customer details including use cases, purchase timeframes, and next steps

  • With your background knowledge, you'll be able to maintain and understand key industry trends and developments 

  • You work closely with our diverse, international and welcoming teams from SDR to Marketing

Qualities we look for

  • 8+ years of Enterprise software sales experience

  • Experience selling into and expanding large Enterprise accounts as well as selling emerging technologies and winning new logos

  • You are known for consistently over-achieving against sales quotas

  • Ability to collaborate with and orchestrate cross-functional teams

  • You feel at home in a fast-paced start-up environment: you're able to shift priorities and adapt to dynamic situations

  • Full fluency in Japanese, and advanced level English abilities

  • You enjoy being part of a team and thrive by supporting your colleagues and collaborating with cross-functional teams

DeepLについて

DeepLは、言語AIを活用したグローバルなコミュニケーション・プラットフォームです。2017年の創業以来、「言葉の壁をなくす」というミッションのもと、人間らしい自然な翻訳と、使いやすい文章作成支援機能を提供してきました。当社のサービスは、現在10万社以上の企業で導入され、新規市場への進出や生産性向上を支えています。また、世界中の何百万人もの人々が、自分の考えを正確に伝えるために利用しています。

私たちの目標は、言語AIの分野で世界のトップになること。より良いコミュニケーションを促進し、人と人とのつながりを生み、社会に実際の変化をもたらす製品を作り続けます。この挑戦を共に進めるために、優秀な仲間を求めています。AI業界の最前線でキャリアを築きたい方、ぜひDeepLで一緒に働きましょう。

DeepLの魅力

DeepLの強みは、最新技術と競争力のある待遇、そして社員が成長できるオープンでフラットな社風です。当社で働く魅力を話すと、ほとんどの人がポジティブな反応を示します。それは、世界中の人々の役に立つ製品や、「言葉の壁をなくす」という共通の目的があるからかもしれません。DeepLの一員になるということは、革新と社員の幸せの両方を大切にするチームに加わることを意味します。詳しくはLinkedInやInstagram、当社ブログで社員の声をご覧ください。

今回募集するポジション

日本市場でエンタープライズ顧客基盤をさらに拡大するため、行動力と自発性のある営業プロフェッショナルを求めています。大手企業への新規開拓と既存顧客の拡大の両方を担っていただきます。エンタープライズ営業（AE）としての実績があり、「言葉の壁のない世界」という当社のビジョンに共感いただける方を歓迎します。少数精鋭チームの一員として、営業プロセスや営業戦略の構築にも関わっていただきます。

主な業務内容

  • 大手法人顧客への提案営業（新規・既存両方）

  • DeepLソリューションの導入提案（DeepL Transalte, DeepL Write, DeepL Voiceなど）

  • 新規見込み顧客の発掘から契約まで、営業サイクル全体をリード

  • 月次の営業目標（アクティビティ数、パイプライン、売上）達成を目指し、Salesforceで正確なパイプライン管理と予測を実施

  • 既存顧客へのアップセル・クロスセルの機会創出

  • 経営層や部長クラスとの関係構築（商談・プレゼンテーション・提案書作成など）

  • 案件の進行状況（ユースケース、導入時期、次のアクション）を把握・管理

  • 業界動向や市場トレンドの把握

  • クロスファンクションチーム（インサイドセールス・マーケティング・カスタマーサクセスなど）と密に連携

求める人物像・経験

  • IT・SaaS業界での法人営業経験8年以上

  • 大手企業への新規提案・拡販の実績

  • 営業目標（数字）に対して高いコミットメントを持ち、継続的に達成してきた方

  • 他部署と連携しながら複数のステークホルダーを巻き込める方

  • 変化の多い環境やスタートアップ的なスピード感を楽しめる方

  • 日本語（ネイティブレベル）＋ 英語（ビジネスレベル以上）

  • チームワークを大切にし、仲間をサポートできる方

What we offer

  • Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing–we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

  • Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy and growth mindset makes us better together.

  • Hybrid work, flexible hours: we offer a hybrid work schedule, with team members coming into the office twice a week. This allows you to engage directly with your team and experience the unique energy of our workspace, while still enjoying the flexibility and comfort of working from home. With flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, we are in sync with your team’s general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration.

  • Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboarding, to company-wide events that bring us all together–literally.

  • Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams–we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

  • 20 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 20 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.

  • Competitive benefits: just as our team spans the globe, so does our benefits package. We've crafted it to reflect the diversity of our team and tailored it to align with your unique location, to ensure you feel supported every step of the way.

  • Virtual Shares: An ownership mindset in every role. We believe everyone should share in our success, and that’s why every employee receives Virtual Shares, linking your contribution directly to DeepL’s growth and rewarding you with a stake in our future.

If this role and our mission resonate with you, but you're hesitant because you don't check all the boxes, don't let that hold you back. At DeepL, it's all about the value you bring and the growth we can foster together. Go ahead, apply—let's discover your potential together. We can't wait to meet you!

We are an equal opportunity employer

You are welcome at DeepL for who you are—we appreciate authenticity here. Our product is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all succeed, contribute, and think forward! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our diversity that we will find the power to break down language barriers in the world.

  • Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.

  • Language: Fluent in English and German

  • Design, implement and analyse experiments to test hypotheses and measure impact

  • Collaborate across product, marketing and the wider data community to improve your craft and cross pollinate insights from multiple teams

  • Self starter with a preference for fast paced, autonomous teams

  • Good communication skills with the ability to tell compelling stories with data

  • Intermediate SQL - preferably using modern data transformation & orchestration tools (e.g., dbt, Airflow)

  • Experience with third-party experimentation (eg: Optimizely, Statsig) or product/digital analytics platforms (eg: Mixpanel, Amplitude) would be a plus

  • Experience running A/B tests or experiments in a product team would be a plus
